Define Documentation

#define APOXI_MAX_CONN_LIMIT   100
 

This interface defines the functionality of an HTTP manager:

  • opening an HTTP connection,
  • initiating HTTP GET, HEAD and POST requests,
  • closing an HTTP connection,
  • querying the status of the HTTP connection. There is no function available for querying the status of individual requests, since this can only be done in a sensible manner by the appli- cation itself. There also are no functions for registering/unregistering an application, since HttpHandler objects are automatically registered for HttpResponseMsg messages through the implementation of the OnMessage function.

This interface also defines the functionality of a WAP manager:

  • registering for WAP push messages,
  • unregistering for WAP push messages,
  • suspending and resuming the WAP connection (=session),
  • querying the status of the WAP connection (=session).

Since the function calls lead to asynchronous calls on communication stacks, the return values of the functions indicate the success of the functions and generally not of the success of the events in the communication stack or beyond.

#define MAXREQUESTLIMIT   100
